common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with Ollama integration in Pieces OS, encountering errors related to cloud service connectivity, Cuda DLLs, and conflicting instances. Proposed solutions include checking network configurations, reinstalling Ollama and Pieces OS, managing startup order, and using smaller local models. Pieces OS version 11.1.2 includes a potential fix, but further testing is required.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohan Rathi reported issues with PiecesOS:
    * Unable to make requests to cloud services
    * Difficulties with local models

**Problems Identified:**

* Potential firewall or network configuration issues blocking PiecesOS requests
* Hardware limitations impacting local models

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark (Pieces support) requested logs for analysis
* Investigation through logs and communication identified two separate issues:
    * Cloud LLM issue caused by personal OpenApi key (resolved by removing the key)
    * Local LLM issue likely due to hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller local model)

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Both cloud and local LLM issues have been resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* A call was scheduled to discuss the issues further, but it is unclear if the call took place.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (waseem852) is experiencing issues with Ollama not working correctly in Pieces.
* The user has tried installing Ollama through different methods (setup, winget, and Pieces itself) but continues to face the same problem.
* The user has confirmed that they have shut down and restarted both Pieces apps and even killed them through Task Manager.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama is not working correctly in Pieces, despite the user's attempts to install and reinstall it.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The support team member (brian-at-pieces) suggested several potential solutions:
    * restarting Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop
    * checking for related issues on GitHub
    * consulting existing documentation and resources
    * scheduling a call with the support team member
* The user has tried restarting Pieces but the issue persists.
* The user has agreed to schedule a call with the support team member to further troubleshoot the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still ongoing but the user is scheduled for a call with the support team member to continue troubleshooting.

**Note:**

This summary focuses on the most important details of the conversation. It does not include all the details discussed, such as the specific error message waseem852 is experiencing.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Conversation Regarding Ollama Server Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* @johnkennyuk was experiencing issues with Ollama server on Pieces OS due to conflicting Cuda12 DLLs.
* The issue was initially thought to be caused by a corrupt Ollama installation, but reinstalling both Ollama and Pieces OS didn't resolve it.
* @johnkennyuk observed that the issue was related to startup order, with Pieces OS attempting to start its own Ollama instance before the external one was fully initialized.

**Problems Identified:**

* Conflicting Cuda12 DLLs between Pieces OS and external Ollama installations.
* Race condition caused by Pieces OS attempting to start its own Ollama instance before the external one was ready.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Reinstalling Ollama and Pieces OS.
* Cleaning up PATH environment variables.
* Disabling Pieces OS launch on sign-in as a workaround.
* Detecting the presence of an external Ollama instance.
* Using CLI to check if an external Ollama instance is running.
* Pushing a change in Pieces OS version 11.1.2 to address the race condition.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue seems to have been resolved for @johnkennyuk after several uninstalls and path cleanups.
* A potential fix was implemented in Pieces OS version 11.1.2, but further testing is required to confirm its effectiveness.

**Additional Notes:**

* @johnkennyuk is still experiencing the issue occasionally.
* @brian-at-pieces is open to scheduling a call to help troubleshoot the issue further.

## Key Takeaways:

* The issue seems to be related to conflicting DLLs and a race condition.
* A potential fix has been implemented, but further testing is needed.
* @johnkennyuk is still experiencing the issue and is seeking further assistance.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS: Issues with Account Linking and Functionality
common_issues.description: Users report problems with linking accounts (Google, GitHub) and application functionality, including cloud service connection errors and local LLM issues. Solutions involve troubleshooting network configurations, resolving OpenApi key conflicts, using smaller local models, and addressing duplicate installations. A new account linking system is planned for future release.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Conversation Summary: Account Linking Issues on Pieces

**Key Points Raised:**

* Johnkennyuk, a Pieces user, raised an issue regarding the inability to link his personal domain (registered to his Google account) to his Github account on the platform.
* Both accounts were initially registered separately due to bugs in older versions of the app, leading to the current linking complications.

**Problems Identified:**

* The existing account linking flow was cumbersome and not user-friendly.
* Johnkennyuk was unable to successfully merge his accounts using Github authentication, despite attempts to resolve the issue directly with Pieces support.
* There were minor inconsistencies between Johnkennyuk's Google and Github emails (a capitalized first letter in Google).
* Github doesn't display email address during account linking consent, potentially contributing to confusion.
* The current authentication service was known to have limitations and was soon to be replaced.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support offered to manually merge Johnkennyuk's accounts.
* A screen recording was requested to diagnose the problem further.
* Pieces support temporarily disabled email privacy on Johnkennyuk's Github account.
* Johnkennyuk's Github account was reset multiple times.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Unfortunately, Johnkennyuk couldn't successfully link his accounts, possibly due to the email inconsistency.
* Pieces support are developing a new account linking system due for mid-March 2025 to resolve such issues.
* Johnkennyuk will wait for the new system implementation and be among the first users to test it out. 
* Johnkennyuk's Github account will be reset again before testing the new system.

**Overall, a solution for account linking is pending the release of a new authentication system in March 2025. Johnkennyuk will then have his accounts merged as desired.**

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohan Rathi reported issues with PiecesOS:
    * Unable to make requests to cloud services
    * Difficulties with local models

**Problems Identified:**

* Potential firewall or network configuration issues blocking PiecesOS requests
* Hardware limitations impacting local models

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark (Pieces support) requested logs for analysis
* Investigation through logs and communication identified two separate issues:
    * Cloud LLM issue caused by personal OpenApi key (resolved by removing the key)
    * Local LLM issue likely due to hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller local model)

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Both cloud and local LLM issues have been resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* A call was scheduled to discuss the issues further, but it is unclear if the call took place.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* MR-AAYU is experiencing issues booting up the Pieces desktop application.
* mark-at-pieces requested log files for investigation.
* MR-AAYU provided log files twice.
* nathan-courtney-pieces identified the issue as having two Pieces for Developers installations.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces desktop application wouldn't boot.
* Two installations of Pieces for Developers were present.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Investigating log files to diagnose the issue.
* Identifying the presence of two installations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue's cause has been identified.
* The solution is not yet provided, but it may involve addressing the duplicate installation issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* MR-AAYU appears to be frustrated by the delay in resolving the issue.
* The conversation ends without a clear resolution.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties launching PiecesOS due to various reasons like invalid port configurations, cloud service connection problems, and potential conflicts with multiple installations. Solutions include verifying network connectivity, checking firewall settings, ensuring correct port values, and resolving installation conflicts.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* Marius Kowalski reported an issue with Pieces desktop app.
* The issue might be related to specific Linux machines.
* Marius is unable to join a live video call for troubleshooting.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces app is encountering an error, details unknown.
* The issue might be specific to certain configurations.
* Troubleshooting requires further investigation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack requested Marius to share the Desktop App log file.
* Mack offered a video call for live troubleshooting, which Marius declined.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation.
* Mack needs to analyze the log file and possibly suggest further solutions.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation suggests similar issues were reported earlier.
* Marius was provided with links to helpful resources, including existing issues and documentation.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues

Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch and Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch or experiencing connectivity problems with cloud services and local LLMs. This can be due to conflicting installations, background updates, firewall restrictions, or hardware limitations. Solutions include checking for duplicate installations, managing startup applications, verifying network connectivity, and using smaller local models or cloud services.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:


**Key Points Raised:**

* ThemePark is experiencing issues with Pieces for VS Code.
* Initially, it works well, but crashes after 10 minutes with a message stating PiecesOS is not running.
* Launching PiecesOS from the crash screen results in a non-dismissable overlay message.

**Problems Identified:**

* Timing conflict between PiecesOS update and Pieces Desktop launch.
* Pieces for VS Code crashing after 10 minutes.
* Non-dismissable overlay message after launching PiecesOS from the crash screen.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Confirm which app is configured to launch on Startup (Pieces Desktop or PiecesOS).
* Avoid launching both apps simultaneously at Startup.
* Investigate the cause of the Pieces for VS Code crash.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* ThemePark is working with Pieces support to diagnose the issue.
* The cause of the crash and overlay message still needs to be identified.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems specific to Pieces for VS Code.
* An image of the overlay message is provided.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohan Rathi reported issues with PiecesOS:
    * Unable to make requests to cloud services
    * Difficulties with local models

**Problems Identified:**

* Potential firewall or network configuration issues blocking PiecesOS requests
* Hardware limitations impacting local models

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark (Pieces support) requested logs for analysis
* Investigation through logs and communication identified two separate issues:
    * Cloud LLM issue caused by personal OpenApi key (resolved by removing the key)
    * Local LLM issue likely due to hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller local model)

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Both cloud and local LLM issues have been resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* A call was scheduled to discuss the issues further, but it is unclear if the call took place.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application UI Bugs
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various UI issues in the Pieces desktop app, including horizontal scrolling problems in code snippets, cursor visibility issues in the Copilot chat window, and non-dismissable overlay messages. These issues persist across different operating systems like Windows and macOS. Proposed solutions involve checking for software updates, ensuring only one Pieces application launches at startup, and waiting for bug fixes from the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Horizontal scrolling doesn't work in JetbRains plugin
related_issues.text:
Horizontal scrolling doesn't work in JetbRains plugin
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, JetBrains

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Horizontal scroll within a code snippet from copilot answer is buggy. I cannot scroll horizontally back and forth to see full line. I need to select text to reach end of line. Once release, my cursor wont appear to scroll left again. Horizontal scrollbar doesn't respond and I cannot select text to left. cursor changes to a drag and drop cursor.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* User @dotnetemmanuel reported an issue with the cursor not hiding when typing in the Pieces Copilot chat window.
* Related issue #638 was mentioned for reference.

**Problems identified:**

* Cursor visibility can be distracting during typing in the Copilot chat window.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces team member @mack-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and committed to investigate it for a future release.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved, but the team is aware and working on a fix.
* Updates will be posted on the issue thread.

related_issues.title: Cursor will not hide when typing in the Copilot chat window
related_issues.text:
Cursor will not hide when typing in the Copilot chat window
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When initially beginning to type a question in the text field in Copilot, the mouse cursor/pointer will not hide and obstructs the text. I can't capture it in a screenshot, but the attachment should hopefully show a brief screen recording of the issue.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2e4e60bb-a8a2-49cd-92a5-35a49b2a63db
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User (@GeoMod) reported a problem with a specific feature's behavior.
* User provided a detailed description of the expected behavior.
* User requested support and clarification on the issue.

**Problems identified:**

* The feature did not function as expected by the user.
* The specific problem with the feature was not explicitly identified in the conversation.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @mack-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and offered to support the user.
* They indicated that the Pieces team might consider implementing support for the desired behavior in a future release.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue was acknowledged by the Pieces team.
* A potential solution was proposed, but no immediate action was taken. 
* The user can expect further updates on the issue in the future.

**Additional notes:**

* The specific details of the user's request and the identified problem were not explicitly mentioned in the conversation. 
* The user can provide more information or ask follow-up questions to clarify the issue and desired outcome.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:


**Key Points Raised:**

* ThemePark is experiencing issues with Pieces for VS Code.
* Initially, it works well, but crashes after 10 minutes with a message stating PiecesOS is not running.
* Launching PiecesOS from the crash screen results in a non-dismissable overlay message.

**Problems Identified:**

* Timing conflict between PiecesOS update and Pieces Desktop launch.
* Pieces for VS Code crashing after 10 minutes.
* Non-dismissable overlay message after launching PiecesOS from the crash screen.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Confirm which app is configured to launch on Startup (Pieces Desktop or PiecesOS).
* Avoid launching both apps simultaneously at Startup.
* Investigate the cause of the Pieces for VS Code crash.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* ThemePark is working with Pieces support to diagnose the issue.
* The cause of the crash and overlay message still needs to be identified.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems specific to Pieces for VS Code.
* An image of the overlay message is provided.

recommendations: **Prioritize Ollama Integration Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve the recurring problems users face with Ollama integration in Pieces OS. Focus on addressing cloud service connectivity errors, Cuda DLL conflicts, and issues related to conflicting instances.

**Improve Account Linking Experience:**  Expedite the development and rollout of the new account linking system planned for mid-March 2025. Ensure the new system provides a seamless and user-friendly experience for linking multiple accounts.

**Address PiecesOS Launch and Connectivity Problems:** Investigate and resolve the root causes behind PiecesOS launch failures and connectivity issues. This includes addressing invalid port configurations, cloud service connection errors, and potential conflicts with multiple installations.

**Enhance UI/UX of Pieces Desktop Application:** Prioritize fixing UI bugs affecting the Pieces desktop app, such as horizontal scrolling issues in code snippets, cursor visibility problems in the Copilot chat window, and non-dismissable overlay messages. Ensure a consistent and intuitive user experience across different operating systems.

**Proactive Communication and Documentation:**  Provide clear and timely communication to users regarding ongoing issues, planned fixes, and workarounds. Update documentation and support resources to address common questions and problems related to Ollama integration, account linking, and application launch issues.
